intro: Phenax laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth phenax, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its smooth, unbranched stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, releasing a mild fragrance when crushed. Phenax laevigatus is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodland floors and stream banks.
